info.title: Mindquarry Document Management System - Technical Documentation
info.subtitle: Description of the architecture of the Mindquarry Document Management System.

abstract.para: This document provides a description of the architecture of the Mindquarry Document Management System.

section.title: Introduction and Overview
section.para:
The Mindquarry Document Management System, short MDMS is an Open Source
Under the conditions of the Mozilla Public License (MPL), Version 1.1 version control and document management system that provides version controlled access to shared documents, offline synchronization with your desktop computer and atom changes.

section.title: Design Goals
section.para: The Mindquarry Document Management System will take existing Version Control Systems like Subversion, which is the most important open source version control system today a step ahead in order to make them more accessible for non-technical users.
Core requirements of the Mindquarry Document Managament Systems are:

listitem.para: Implemented in Java in order to allow easy integration with the existing Mindquarry components and to allow easy cross-platform deployment

Distributed - there should be no single version repository that needs access for every operation and accordingly network connectivity. Instead operations like updating and comparing revisions should be made from a local repository whenever possible in order to reduce network load.
Content-aware - The version control system should be able to detect different file types and merge them intelligently. XML-based Office file formats are of highest priority.
Web Integration - The system should offer a web based user interface and operations should fit into the architecture model of the world wide web to allow integration with other web-based applications
Replicatability - the underlying content store should be replicable in order to allow for heavy load deployments
Support for XML as a content format with intelligent merge
Support for Office-documents in ODF and OpenXML as document formats with intelligent merge
